messages.message:
yup, add `autocomplete="off"`.

> should we add a `type="count"` to disallow non-numeric characters?
that would be problematic for 3 main reasons:
• `type` is an html-specified value & does not refer to custom layers on top an html input.
• Adding `count` is a dangerous pattern which would bloat `Input` as we introduce more & more custom types
• Custom types like `count` may benefit from / require different prop type restrictions which would get very complex if built directly into `Input`
What you’re looking for is a wrapper around `Input` called `CounterInput` or something w/ its own restricted set of props & built-in validation.
That way I could also add storybook entries for each new custom input type that builds on top of `Input`.

Might be good to discuss which types could be beneficial during Frontend guild to gauge how useful these special types would be
